image.altText: A power station looms over trees and a curved road, emitting vapour.

props.synopsis: Amid swirling debate among conservative politicians over decarbonisation, energy bosses have warned against turning away from net zero despite cost pressures.

title.children: Energy CEOs say 'no turning back' on renewables transition

image.altText: Side-by-side photos of Bianca Jones and Holly Bowles, two Melbourne teens

props.synopsis: The Laos hostel accused of serving alcohol contaminated with methanol that killed six people — including two young Australian women — last November is set to reopen.

title.children: Parents of methanol victim label Vang Vieng hostel's plans 'disgusting'

image.altText: Bethany Clarke and Simone White drinking from coconuts.

props.synopsis: A survivor of last year's Laos mass methanol poisoning has started a campaign to educate travellers on the dangers of the toxic form of alcohol.

title.children: Laos methanol poisoning survivor 'turning grief into action'

image.altText: Close up of Ley, not speaking

props.synopsis: It was only a week ago that the moderates in the Liberal Party were flexing their muscle privately (and some publicly), threatening a divorce with the Nationals and to walk the plank if net zero was dumped. Neither threat ever materialised.

title.children: Ley puts her one advantage at risk as she scrabbles to keep leadership

image.altText: Gloved hands use tweezers to examine pink coloured sand in a zip-lock bag.

props.synopsis: Concerned families and retailers are inundating a materials testing laboratory with enquiries, since news broke that asbestos had been detected in decorative and coloured sand for children.

title.children: Families flock to hazard testing lab amid asbestos sand concerns

image.altText: A young woman wearing a pink jacket takes a selfie photo while clutching a notepad with text on it.

props.synopsis: Family and former colleagues of a Ukrainian journalist who was captured by Russian forces and tortured are determined to do everything they can to ensure those who contributed to her death are held responsible.

title.children: 'They were trying to erase her': Family seek justice for tortured journalist

image.altText: Woman in foreground and man looking towards her.

props.synopsis: The strange macho appeal of fossilised vegetation means that 30 years of annual United Nations meetings to stop the planet heating any more have been a bust.

title.children: The strange macho appeal of fossil fuels in a world struggling with net zero

image.altText: A blonde woman talks while wearing a red MAGA baseball cap.

props.synopsis: Once considered one of Donald Trump's most loyal soldiers, Marjorie Taylor Greene has found herself an outcast of the MAGA firm.

title.children: How Epstein drove a wedge between Trump and one of his most hardline advocates

image.altText: Anthony Albanese wears high-vis and a hard hat.

props.synopsis: The federal government is considering a power-purchase agreement with Tomago to supply electricity at a stable price, after warnings the smelter may need to close because of rising power costs.

title.children: Government considers dramatic intervention to save Tomago smelter

image.altText: Woman in foreground and man looking towards her.

props.synopsis: Emissions reduction would no longer be an objective of Australia's energy operator under a Coalition plan endorsed by the Nationals and Liberals, prioritising affordability and reliability over climate.

title.children: Coalition plans to strip climate from energy operator's objectives

image.altText: Security officials inspect the site of the explosion.

props.synopsis: India's National Investigation Agency says two men behind last week's deadly car blast in Delhi were from Kashmir, a region that has been the source of tension between India and Pakistan.

title.children: Man arrested over deadly Delhi suicide bombing

image.altText: A building with a blue sign that reads: Evatt Primary School.

props.synopsis: The ACT will close more schools after additional coloured sand products were recalled by Kmart and Target, while the schools that were shut on Friday will reopen on Monday.

title.children: ACT to close 69 schools after extra coloured sand products recalled

image.altText: Russia's Islam Makhachev, top, grapples with Australia's Jack Della Maddalena in a UFC fight.

props.synopsis: Jack Della Maddalena was confident he could fight his way out of Islam Makhachev's grappling prowess, but it wasn't the case in front of a packed New York crowd.

title.children: Australian Jack Della Maddalena crushed in UFC title defence

props.synopsis: Metallica's unusual gig, John Lennon's murder and a king's abdication — how well do you know this week in history?

title.children: Do you know what Holden made before cars? Test your history knowledge

image.altText: Tony Abbott stares into the distance.

props.synopsis: In 2011, Tony Abbott was questioned over his use of the phrase "shit happens" when discussing the death of an Australian soldier in Afghanistan. Instead of responding, he stared at the journalist, fighting the urge to thump him.

title.children: Abbott addresses unusual 2011 stare-off with journalist

image.altText: A selfie Emma Dickeson has taken of herself wearing activewear posing on a elevated waking path.

props.synopsis: Emma Dickeson says her "school night" adventures are about devoting time and attention to the things that energise you.

title.children: The benefits of not just living for the weekend

image.altText: A woman sits in a chair in a hospital room, holding the hand of a man sitting on the edge of the bed beside her.

props.synopsis: More than 90 Tasmanians who have been medically cleared to leave hospital are not able to because they are waiting for an aged care place or NDIS support. Premier Jeremy Rockliff says it's "not good enough" and is calling on the federal government to increase hospital funding.

title.children: More than 90 patients stuck in Tasmanian hospitals waiting for aged care or NDIS support

image.altText: Mobile grandstrand crushed from car impact.

props.synopsis: Six of 13 patients remain in hospital after a derby car crashed into a grandstand full of spectators at a Walcha council-run rally on Saturday night.

title.children: Demolition derby crash victims in 'stable' conditions

image.altText: Eight ambulances parked in rows at the Royal Hobart Hospital emergency department.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian government's "ban" on ambulance ramping was announced with much fanfare in 2024 — but there has been no effect on ambulance response times, and patients are still facing long waits in hospital emergency departments.

title.children: Tasmanian ambulance ramping 'ban' not reducing response times

image.altText: young man walks along beach shore wearing a backpack

props.synopsis: For 18-year-old Rivi, knowing what gear to leave behind can be as important as knowing what to take with.

title.children: Survival-inspired camping is the ultimate challenge — how long would you last?

image.altText: Mika Noodt looks confused

props.synopsis: A missed turn on the bike, a miscount on the run and an athlete protest turn the T100 Dubai event into a farce, with New Zealander Hayden Wilde left particularly livid.

title.children: 'What's going on?' Chaos erupts at Dubai triathlon

image.altText: A person's hands hold a book open to pages with photos on them

props.synopsis: More than 20 years after this photo was purportedly taken, it continues to haunt Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor.

title.children: The infamous photo former prince Andrew can't outrun

image.altText: A woman wearing a head and body covering sitting on the sandy desert floor with part of a tent behind her

props.synopsis: With Sudan's El-Fasher captured by a militia accused of mass killings, those who escaped are suffering in a refugee camp and mourning the deaths of family and friends.

title.children: 'They threw themselves on people and killed them': Militia kills thousands in Sudan

image.altText: Aaron Papazoglu sits wearing dark glasses, the 19 year old is charged over a pedestrian crash that killed a pregnant mum

props.synopsis: The 19-year-old accused of causing a crash at Hornsby on Friday night that claimed the life of a pregnant woman and her unborn child is denied bail.

title.children: Police allege teen accused of killing pregnant mum ran orange light before crash

image.altText: Two girls at a table eating meals.

props.synopsis: Despite thousands of cases of food poisoning, Indonesia's government intends to expand a controversial program giving schoolchildren free meals.

title.children: More than 10,000 children poisoned by free school meals in Indonesia

props.synopsis: For more than two decades, Sergey Lavrov has been Russia's top foreign diplomat, representing the Kremlin's regime around the world, but late last month, he disappeared.

title.children: He was Putin's top ally on the world stage. And then, he was gone

image.altText: Perth City and Claisebrook Cove

props.synopsis: Western Australians must shake off their aversion to apartment living and embrace high-density housing solutions to support population growth across the metropolitan area, the state government says.

title.children: High-density housing to transform Perth suburbs, as plans to cut red tape flagged

image.altText: A man holding a joint and a styrofoam cup uses his phone torch to illuminate something at which he and a woman stare intently.

props.synopsis: The Sydney-born movie star discusses how her creative partnership with If I had Legs I'd Kick You director Mary Bronstein has opened the Oscars conversation.

title.children: Sophisticated comedy or horror movie: Rose Byrne says you decide

image.altText: Zac Lomax runs with the ball while playing for the Eels

props.synopsis: Parramatta star Zac Lomax is released from the final three years of his NRL contract, fuelling speculation of a move to breakaway rugby competition R360.

title.children: Lomax released by Eels, fuelling speculation of R360 switch

image.altText: Dark clouds over Brisbane's skyline.

props.synopsis: The Bureau of Meteorology says parts of Queensland and New South Wales will likely see smaller pockets of severe thunderstorm activity on Sunday.

title.children: Heavy rain forecast for parts of Queensland after two rescued from floodwaters

image.altText: A rescue team wade through flood water on a street in Wales.

props.synopsis: Storm Claudia moves to Wales, swamping the town of Monmouth, where dozens of people are rescued or evacuated from their homes.

title.children: Storm Claudia causes floods across the UK, after killing three in Portugal

image.altText: Penny Wong holds a press conference in a corridor in Parliament House

props.synopsis: Foreign Minister Penny Wong has refused to say how much it would cost Australia to hold the COP31 climate conference, as negotiations over hosting rights enter the final stages.

title.children: Wong won't put price tag on COP31 as final host decision looms

image.altText: Kay Trembath stands behind bar of Winton Hotel.

props.synopsis: As the Winton Hotel in outback Queensland changes hands, an accommodation broker says the cost of housing in coastal areas is driving outback pub and hotel sales, as a place to live and do business.

title.children: Buying a business and place to live for the price of a house in Brisbane

image.altText: A side view of Anthony Albanese as he is interviewed in a radio booth.

props.synopsis: When a delegation of "influencers" appeared at Canberra's budget lock-up this year, joining press gallery journalists in the increasingly arcane tradition of reading a complex document for a few quiet hours before bursting forth in analysis thereof, much comment was made.

title.children: We're trapped in the Attention Olympics — and it's changing how we vote

image.altText: Bright orange rotary landline telephone against a bright blue background

props.synopsis: As smartphones swallow childhood, a growing movement of parents is reinstalling landlines, hoping an old-school corded phone can restore patience and connection.

title.children: How the landline is making a comeback
